page.title: 14BULCOTE-FARMING-MILKING
page.content: The cows first milking is at 5.30a.m. and the second milking is at 3.30p.m. It takes 2-3hrs in the morning and afternoon.Each cow produces 5 gallons a day on average.In the winter they eat silage,winter wheat and straw. In the summer they eat grass. There are 485 cows altogether and the breed is Old English Friesian. Mr.Estrop the farmer wakes at 5.30a.m for the cows first milking and starts work at 5.45a.m.Milking finishes at 8.00a.m. and then he has to clean and scrub the parlour.The rest of the morning is taken up with sterilising the milk or erecting fencing.A "big" lunch break follows from 12.00-1.00pm. After lunch he either moves paddock fencing,bellcarts or in the summer makes silage.There is a tea break at 3.00p.m. and the second milking at 3.30pm.He usually gets home at 6.00pm.
